title: Clean Onboarding page Server Component error
description:
## Summary
The Clean Onboarding page at /[emailAccountId]/clean/onboarding throws a Server Components render error in production. The error message is hidden in production builds for security.

## URL with Error
https://iz.salsven.com/cmi2b38wg0045pi0tqxwi2rve/clean/onboarding?chatId=8c44c8d1-a85d-448b-a689-ef97805c1512

## Error Message
An error occurred in the Server Components render. The specific message is omitted in production builds to avoid leaking sensitive details. A digest property is included on this error instance which may provide additional details about the nature of the error.

## Files to Investigate
- apps/web/app/(app)/[emailAccountId]/clean/onboarding/page.tsx - Main page component
- apps/web/utils/email/provider.ts - createEmailProvider function
- apps/web/utils/assess.ts - getUnhandledCount function
- apps/web/utils/email-account.ts - checkUserOwnsEmailAccount function

## Debugging Steps
1. Check server logs for the actual error (docker logs)
2. Add error boundary to catch and log the specific error
3. Test locally with NODE_ENV=production to reproduce
4. Check if emailAccountId is valid and user has access
5. Verify createEmailProvider and getUnhandledCount dont throw

## Possible Causes
- Email provider creation failing (missing OAuth tokens?)
- Database query failing
- Permission check failing silently
- Props.params/searchParams Promise handling issue

title: Automation Test tab error and missing History
description:
## Summary
The Automation page Test tab shows 'There was an error - An unexpected error occurred' when testing. Additionally, the History tab shows no history entries.

## URLs with Errors
- Test tab: https://iz.salsven.com/cmi2b38wg0045pi0tqxwi2rve/automation?tab=test&chatId=eec342aa-4f65-4665-b744-3113c8ec807e
- History tab: https://iz.salsven.com/cmi2b38wg0045pi0tqxwi2rve/automation?tab=history

## Symptoms
1. Test tab: Shows error modal 'There was an error - An unexpected error occurred'
2. History tab: No history entries displayed (empty)

## Files to Investigate
- apps/web/app/(app)/[emailAccountId]/assistant/Process.tsx - Test tab component
- apps/web/app/(app)/[emailAccountId]/assistant/History.tsx - History tab component
- Related API routes for testing and history fetching

## Debugging Steps
1. Check browser Network tab for failed API calls
2. Check server logs for error details
3. Verify AI provider configuration (API key, model settings)
4. Check if rules exist for the email account
5. Verify database has ExecutedRule entries for history

## Possible Causes
- AI API key not configured or invalid
- AI provider endpoint issues
- Database query errors
- Missing or misconfigured rules
- Rate limiting from AI provider
